Title: Trainer Arrival and Set up
Description: The OPERA Training team will arrive today and need to set up the Systems training room and Service room

Title: Kick Off Meeting
Description:
Kick off meeting with department heads:
Front Office
Housekeeping
Accounting
Group Housing

Title: Property Orientation Day
Description:
Property lead - must be done prior to trainer arrival.
**Property to advise on actual date.**

Title: Systems Intro
Description: FSPMS Introduction - For associates that will attend other FSPMS courses or those that need just a basic understanding of FSPMS, Topics covered include basic navigation, reading the house count, room types and statuses, finding and accessing reservations, reading the reservation screen, guest messaging, and guest history. Intro to FSPMS will be a pre-requisite for all other FSPMS training.

Title: Meet & Greet & Tour
Description: Front Office Leadership to Meet with Trainer on first day to review progress, training calendar & expectations  and tour department area. (Does not have to be exactly at time scheduled)

Title: Record Management
Description: FSPMS Record Management - The Guest Record Management module will expand on the use of the Guest Record, and outline some processes for Guest Record tasks that occur before and after a guestâ€™s arrival. Topics covered include blocking a guest into a specific room, room moves, cancelling a reservation, extending and adding a rate change, pre-registering a guest, and housekeeping service details.

Title: Meet & Greet & Tour
Description: Front Office Leadership to Meet with Trainer on first day to review progress, training calendar & expectations  and tour department area. (Does not have to be exactly at time scheduled)

Title: Test Meal
Description:
Discussion of Food Show and Test Meals logistics.

For Culinary & F&B Leaders

Title: Housekeeping Room Staging/Placement Review with Trainer
Description: Work with Housekeeping Leadership on room placement and property readiness check.

Title: Device Training
Description:
Training with all associates that will use EMPOWER Devices. **Devices must be configured and set-up prior to this training and all applicable associates are users in EMPOWER.**

For Housekeeping/Engineering

Title: Housekeeping - Hotel Readiness
Description:
Dependent on Hotel needs and leadership led. Areas of focus would be:
Organize Storage/Linen Closets
Housekeeping Cart Set-up
Public Space Clean Up and Readiness (Pool, Fitness Center, ect)
Elevator and Hallway Deep Cleaning
Room Placement and Readiness

Title: Banquet Zoning/Staging
Description:
Trainer and property led. This time is to prepare the work space for an open hotel. This can include:
Cleaning, Organizing, and Set-up.

Title: Guest Registration
Description: FSPMS Guest Registration - This module will review the Guest Reservation/record, field usage, and the check-in process including room selection, updating methods of payment, and accommodating walk-in reservations.

Title: Bar Set up - Prep and Oraganization (Beverage team)
Description:
Trainer and property led. This time is to prepare the work space for an open hotel. This can include:
Cleaning, Organizing, and Set-up.

Title: Guest Accounting
Description: FSPMS Guest Accounting - The module will review the guest accounting options of FSPMS including posting credits, posting charges, adjusting charges, correcting charges, transferring charges, tracking checks cashed for a guest, checking-out an account,viewing folio detail, batch posting charges

Title: Food Show
Additional Positions: F&B FOH, Front Office, Event Operations
Description:
The Culinary Food Show has a few purposes:
Supports the education of the front of the house associates. 
Teaches menu knowledge, storytelling and product identification. As a result the team should be able to speak to the menu, identify local/regional items, knowledgably speak to ingredients associated to food allergens, speak passionately towards house crafted items and highlight components of unique signature dishes.
Aids in assisting the culinary team with finalizing recipes, cooking techniques, plate presentation and organization of the line.
Open and operating hotel retraining for of both front and back of the house associates to make sure all are aligned with the same vision.

Title: Bar Set up - Prep and Oraganization (Beverage team)
Description:
Trainer and property led. This time is to prepare the work space for an open hotel. This can include:
Cleaning, Organizing, and Set-up.

Description: Property led. Date and Time dependent on scheduling.

Description: Property lead training. The hotel is encouraged to invite a person/company from the local area (or Concierge Team) to talk about the local area.
